articles.headline: Bribery Case Cracks Open European Parliament — and Finds Hidden Cash
articles.snippet: Prosecutors say the glamorous lifestyle of a European lawmaker masked a Qatari corruption scandal. It exposed how vulnerable Brussels is to foreign influence.
articles.abstract: Prosecutors say the glamorous lifestyle of a European lawmaker masked a Qatari corruption scandal. It exposed how vulnerable Brussels is to foreign influence.
articles.lead_paragraph: Princes and presidents traversed the white marble floors of the ultra-selective V.V.I.P. box overlooking the field for the first game of the World Cup. But mingling among the soccer legends and Gulf royals was a figure few outside European politics would recognize: Eva Kaili.
articles.byline: By Matina Stevis-Gridneff, Monika Pronczuk, Tariq Panja and Sarah Hurtes

articles.headline: Protesters in Peru Demand Justice for Ousted President Pedro Castillo
articles.snippet: Eight days after Pedro Castillo’s removal from office and arrest, thousands of his supporters have joined protests demanding his reinstatement. To them, he is the voice of the marginalized.
articles.abstract: Eight days after Pedro Castillo’s removal from office and arrest, thousands of his supporters have joined protests demanding his reinstatement. To them, he is the voice of the marginalized.
articles.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru — Outside a detention center at the foot of the Andes Mountains, a camp has formed in recent days, with as many as 1,000 people traveling hundreds of miles to demand freedom for the highest-profile detainee: their former president, Pedro Castillo.
articles.byline: By Julie Turkewitz and Mitra Taj

articles.headline: New Federal Rule Has Done Little to Stem Spread of ‘Ghost Guns’
articles.snippet: Sellers of key components of the untraceable homemade firearms have been interpreting the rule in the narrowest possible way.
articles.abstract: Sellers of key components of the untraceable homemade firearms have been interpreting the rule in the narrowest possible way.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden celebrated the adoption of a federal rule in August that cracked down on the online sale of untraceable components for weapons known as ghost guns as a major step in stemming gun violence. But the rule has done little to stop the sale of key parts used to make deadly homemade firearms, according to officials and gun control groups.

articles.headline: A Traditional Exchange? FTX Was Anything But.
articles.snippet: FTX called itself an exchange. But it was vastly different from stock exchanges, which are highly regulated and barred from engaging in many of the activities FTX pursued.
articles.abstract: FTX called itself an exchange. But it was vastly different from stock exchanges, which are highly regulated and barred from engaging in many of the activities FTX pursued.
articles.lead_paragraph: Cryptocurrency trading platforms like FTX have acquired a sheen of legitimacy in recent years by billing themselves as exchanges — creating an association with staid and trusted financial institutions like the New York Stock Exchange and Nasdaq.

articles.headline: Elon Musk, Management Guru?
articles.snippet: Why the Twitter owner’s ruthless, unsparing style has made him a hero to many bosses in Silicon Valley.
articles.abstract: Why the Twitter owner’s ruthless, unsparing style has made him a hero to many bosses in Silicon Valley.
articles.lead_paragraph: It may seem obvious, to most people outside Silicon Valley, that Elon Musk’s ownership of Twitter has been an unmitigated disaster.

articles.headline: A Businessman, Buffaloes and a Sofa Full of Cash: A President’s Alibi
articles.snippet: A bizarre scandal threatens to topple President Cyril Ramaphosa of South Africa from leadership of the African National Congress, which begins its party conference on Friday. Will A.N.C. members buy his astonishing account?
articles.abstract: A bizarre scandal threatens to topple President Cyril Ramaphosa of South Africa from leadership of the African National Congress, which begins its party conference on Friday. Will A.N.C. members buy his astonishing account?
articles.lead_paragraph: JOHANNESBURG — The story begins when a Sudanese businessman landed in the Johannesburg airport two days before Christmas 2019, according to his account, rolling a carry-on suitcase with $600,000 in cash. He said he had wanted to surprise his South African wife for her birthday, and buy a house.
articles.byline: By John Eligon and Lynsey Chutel

articles.headline: Can Child Care Be a Big Business? Private Equity Thinks So.
articles.snippet: Some high-end chains are surprisingly profitable, and they are trying to shape child care policy in Washington.
articles.abstract: Some high-end chains are surprisingly profitable, and they are trying to shape child care policy in Washington.
articles.lead_paragraph: The prices can rival college tuition: Bright Horizons charges up to $44,000 a year for child care in Seattle; at KinderCare in Manhattan, it is up to $40,000.
